title: Stock Surge Eases As Bond Rally Resumes; Oil Falls: Markets Wrap
text:
A global stock surge sparked by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s dovish comments showed signs of waning on Wednesday, lingering trade-war concerns.
The post Stock Surge Eases As Bond Rally Resumes; Oil Falls: Markets Wrap appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Global stocks gain in Fed's cheery slipstream, dollar subdued
text: Global stocks gained for a third straight day on Wednesday, bolstered by investors' growing hopes that the Federal Reserve might cut interest rates this year to boost a slowing global economy, while the dollar languished near seven-week lows.

title: Tier, the Berlin-based e-scooter rental startup, unveils new hardware and announces it’s reached 2M rides
text: Tier, the Berlin-based e-scooter rental startup that competes with the likes of Voi, Lime, Wind, Circ and a host of others, is unveiling new hardware today in a bid to further improve the usability and unit economics of its service.

title: 5 Ways the Bulls Are Underestimating Trade War’s Damage
text: The stock market's relative strength in the face of mounting trade war pressures belies the real risks.

title: 95% Gone
text: For the past nine months, manufacturing sentiment has been falling off a cliff as the impact of tariffs (both actual and threatened) put a damper on sentiment.

title: June Dividend Achiever Dogs Chase Gains And Upsides

title: Modern Monetary Theory’s Reluctant Poster Child: Japan
text: Despite its huge debt, the country remains an economic powerhouse. Some say it provides a model for the United States, but its leaders disavow the idea.

title: China's importers apply for tariff waivers on U.S. goods
text: Chinese importers are preparing applications for waivers on import tariffs levied on more than 700 U.S. goods in the Sino-U.S trade war, after the Ministry of Finance said it would start taking submissions.

title: Fed cheer lifts Asian shares, leaves dollar on back foot
text: Asian shares advanced on Wednesday after comments from Federal Reserve officials suggested a U.S. rate cut this year was on the cards, boosting investor sentiment and pushing the dollar lower.

title: Europe set for minor gains at the open as global markets bounce back
text: European stocks are expected to start Wednesday's session on a slightly upbeat note.

title: China's central bank is poised to cut interest rates amid trade war, economist says
text: The People's Bank of China is expected lower rates twice later in 2019 and once in 2020 amid the country's trade fight with the U.S., said a Bank of America Merrill Lynch economist on Wednesday.

title: Major Economic Trends: All Downbeat
